intro: Orlaya media, commonly known as the common orlaya, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Ranunculaceae family, which includes buttercups and other showy flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and riverbanks. Its flowers are small, yellow, and often have five petals, while its leaves are trifoliate. Orlaya media is often considered a weed in agricultural settings due to its rapid growth and ability to spread easily.
